articles.title: Aussie cricket great reveals umpires don't TRUST snicko technology after repeated controversial decisions in Adelaide during the third Test
articles.description: Aussie cricket great Ricky Ponting has revealed umpires have grave concerns about trusting the DRS technology - who operate snicko - during the Ashes series.
articles.content:
Cricket great Ricky Ponting has revealed umpires have grave concerns about trusting the DRS technology - who operate snicko - during the Ashes series.

articles.title: 'Careers are on the line': cricket union blasts Snicko
articles.description: The boss of the Australian Cricketers' Association is demanding an urgent review into failing Snicko technology, warning careers are at risk.
articles.content:
Careers are at risk because of failing Snicko technology, Australian cricket's players' union says.
The Australian Cricketers' Association (ACA) is demanding an urgent review into the technology which has caused controversy in the Ashes.

articles.title: Police ID suspect in Brown University shooting, probe link with MIT killing
articles.description: PROVIDENCE, Rhode Island, Dec 18 (Reuters) - Law enforcement officers have identified a suspect in last weekend's ‌deadly mass shooting at Brown University, and are investigating a possible link to the murder ‌of a Massachusetts Institute of Technology professor two days later near Boston, a person familiar with the matter said.

articles.description: Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU), a leading memory and storage chipmaker, closed Thursday at $248.55, up 10.11%. Trading volume reached 63.9 million shares,
articles.content: Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU), a leading memory and storage chipmaker, closed Thursday at $248.55, up 10.11%. Trading volume reached 63.9 million shares, about 139% above its three-month average of 26.7 million shares. Micron Technology IPO’d in 1984... [2043 chars]

articles.title: New 'gamechanging' spike detector technology that can tell if your vape has drugs in it to be trialed by police over Christmas
articles.description: Officers have deployed a one-of-a-kind portable 'vape testing kit' designed by academics at the University of Bath to detect dangerous psychoactive substances in vapes.
articles.content:
Scotland Yard is piloting new 'gamechanging' substance-detection technology to counter surging spiking offences in the capital over the festive period.
Officers have deployed a one-of-a-kind portable ‘vape testing kit’ designed by academics at the Un... [3336 chars]
